DOC.HEADLINE: 2 killed as planes collide off southern England

TEXT.P: British police say two people have been killed after two small planes collided above the Isle of Wight off England's south coast.
Hampshire Police say the victims were in a plane that hit another and crashed into woods near the island's main town, Ryde, on Saturday afternoon.
The second plane, also with two people aboard, was damaged but managed to land at a nearby airfield.
The Isle of Wight is a popular sailing and holiday destination in the English Channel.
